instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3332: What is 820-3332? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U5701: What is U5701? this is the keyboard controller chip that takes the keyboard and trackpad input and turns it into a USB device signal for the machine to process. If replacing a keyboard doesnâ€™t fix an issue with keys not typing, check all traces between keyboard connector and this IC. This chip has programming so it must be replaced from a similar, ideally identical board. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A  Track Pad works but won't select a object when clicked.
threads.message:
I put this one away after a few hours.   Unit had water damage and a PP3V42 short which I repaired only to find out that the "click" does not work on the track pad.   I have to use a external mouse.   I thought the track pad probably got wet so I pulled the glued in battery and the track pad only to find out it was not the track pad.

I put this one back together before I smashed something and have moved on with my work load but I have a question.

Is the "click" a discrete line I can check resistance on or part of a data package that goes to <CHIP>U5701</CHIP>?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A  Track Pad works but won't select a object when clicked.
threads.message:
Check <RESISTOR>R5703</RESISTOR>.
<SIGNAL>PICKB_L</SIGNAL> must drop to 0V when TP click is activated.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A  Track Pad works but won't select a object when clicked.
threads.message:
Well that was excellent advice.   I was not sure what data line was actually the "click"  Thanks so very much!  I was able to feel confident enough to tear out the battery and track pad all over again to replace it once more.   I must of had a bad trackpad.  These models are crazy hard to change trackpads and I got to do it twice.   

Unit came in for now power so this was a nice bonus after I fixed the LB
